srclib

("source lib")



A polyglot source code analysis library, built with hackability in mind.

Integrate with your editor, build documentation for your code, or perform type inference - all with the same tool, all open source.



Watch a quick demo of srclib in Emacs
{% include "editors.html" %}

The Challenge

Given M editors, N languages, and O features, one would have to make M×N×O plugins - a virtual nightmare for any language analysis tool.

The Solution

srclib provides a unified data model, with language analysis toolchains built on a single platform.

srclib also exposes an API, allowing editors and other programs to perform detailed queries on the analysis results.

Different ways to use srclib


Run srclib on your code

Features

  • Jump to Definition
  • Find Usage Examples
  • Type Inference
  • Autocomplete
  • Dependency Resolution
For more info, check out this screencast.

Integrations

scrlib aims to provide high-quality editor plugins for its language analysis platform.

Install the plugin for your editor (or hack on one if we don't support it yet).

Install srclib in your editor

Languages

srclib currently supports Ruby, Python, Node.js, and Go.

If you're a developer with a love of language analysis, be sure to check out the other languages people are working on here.
